newsitem.title: USA: CBOT soybeans turn higher late on crop tour report.
newsitem.headline: CBOT soybeans turn higher late on crop tour report.

text.p: CBOT soybean futures turned higher in late dealings on a report from the Midwest crop tour of low soybean and corn yield potential in eastern Iowa and Minnesota, traders said.
Traders said there was a report from the Professional Farmers of America tour that eastern Iowa corn yields and soy pod counts were below average.
Early Thursday the soybean market was lower on bearish input from Wednesday's tour of Illinois.
Overall good crop weather in the U.S. Midwest also pressured the market.
"The crop is improving, the weather has been beneficial to the crop," said Steve Bruce of E.D. and F. Man International.
Nearby September soybeans were higher on overall firm cash basis markets this week and tight supplies of soybeans.
At 1253 CDT, soybeans were two to 7-1/4 cents per bushel higher, with September up 7-1/4 at $8.07-1/2.
